longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for the period of intended stay. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of a National ID Card issued to nationals of United
  Kingdom. 

Visa required, except for Holders of British passports
endorsed  British Citizen .
Visa required, except for A max. stay of 90 days: 
 - for holders of British passports endorsed  British National
   (Overseas)"; 
 - for holders of British passports endorsed  British Overseas
   Territiories Citizen  issued by Anguilla, Bermuda,
   Montserrat, Turks and Caicos Isl. and Virgin Isl.
   (British); 
 - for holders of British passports endorsed  British Subject 
   also containing a Certificate of Entitlement to the Right
   of Abode issued by the United Kingdom; 
Visa required, except for A max. stay of 90 days for those
arriving in Guadeloupe and Martinique: 
 - for holders of British passports endorsed  British Overseas
   Territiories Citizen  issued by Cayman Isl.; 
Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold documents required for their
  next destination(SEE NOTE 44764). 
    NOTE 44764: Not applicable to nationals of EEA Member
   States  and Switzerland. 
Warning:
- Visitors not holding return/onward tickets  co
  uld be refused entry. (SEE NOTE 44764) 
    NOTE 44764: Not applicable to nationals of EEA Member
   States  and Switzerland
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving in
Guadeloupe or Martinique within 6 days after leaving or
transiting countries with risk of yellow fever transmission
For details, click here. 

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 1 year of age.
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission provided not leaving the transit areas.
